I am a first-year PhD student in Computer Science at Purdue University. My research interests include IoT security and privacy, wireless network security, systems security, web security, and adversarial machine learning.
I received my B.Sc. and M.Sc. degrees in Computer Science and Engineering from Sabanci University. In my master’s thesis, I implemented a data-driven intrusion detection system for 6LoWPAN based IoT systems under the supervision of Prof. Albert Levi.
I also worked as a Research Intern at Purdue University under the supervision of Dr. Z. Berkay Celik. The aim of the internship was to develop security solutions for IoT systems. We implemented a secure and robust context-based sensor pairing scheme in the smart home/office context. Our work (One Key to Rule Them All: Secure Group Pairing for Heterogeneous IoT Devices) has been accepted to IEEE S&P 2023.
